Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Selective \Se*lect"ive\, a. Selecting; tending to select. [1913 Webster]
This selective providence of the Almighty. --Bp. Hall. [1913 Webster]

selective adj 1: tending to select; characterized by careful choice; "an exceptionally quick and selective reader"- John Mason Brown 2: characterized by very careful or fastidious selection; "the school was very selective in its admissions"
